title: try Ireland make a statement with win in England
desc: Ireland's Under-20s tore up the script at Bath's Recreation Ground, delivering a thunderous 31-21 Six Nations Championship victory over England that felt every inch a statement.

title: Trump announces 10% global tariff, slams justices after US Supreme Court decision
desc: The high court ruled the US President's use of an emergency powers law to set import duties without Congress was illegal.

title: Jesse Jackson won't lie in honor at US Capitol Rotunda
desc: House Speaker Mike Johnson’s office has denied a request to have the late Rev. Jesse Jackson lie in honor in the United States Capitol Rotunda due to precedents that such honors are usually only designated for presidents.

title: Jonathan Rhys Meyers calls LA wildfire loss 'cathartic'
desc: Jonathan Rhys Meyers has described losing his Malibu home during California wildfires last year as "cathartic".

title: Media mogul Rupert Murdoch’s second wife dies at 81
desc: “I thought we had a wonderful, happy marriage. Obviously, we didn’t,” the media mogul’s second wife – mother of Elisabeth, Lachlan and James – said after their 31-year marriage ended.

title: NZ man in Australia kept on committing crime despite a warning
desc: WARNING: This article includes discussion of family violence offending and may be distressing. A New Zealand citizen who avoided deportation from Australia...

title: ‘I won the league with Liverpool’: Arne Slot responds to Wayne Rooney jibe
desc: Arne Slot pointed to Liverpool’s title win last season in response to Wayne Rooney’s claim that he lacked the aura to manage the club

title: Ontario allows early-morning alcohol sales for gold medal hockey game
desc: The Ontario government will allow bars and restaurants across the province to start selling alcohol at 6 a.m. ET on Sunday as the Canadian men’s hockey team competes for a gold medal at the Winter Olympics.

title: Reviewing all the 2026 Oscar short films: What should win?
desc: Treats in small packages await the curious as the academy nominates five worthy shorts each in live-action, documentary and animation. Here's a guide to help you win your Oscar pool.

title: IOC to probe FIFA president Infantino after Trump meeting
desc: After FIFA leader Gianni Infantino took part in U.S. President Donald Trump's Board of Peace launch, IOC President Kirsty Coventry said the Olympic body will "look into" his conduct.
